definition: erhua variant of 聊天[liao2 tian1]
erhua variant of 前半天[qian2 ban4 tian1]
erhua variant of 頭半天|头半天[tou2 ban4 tian1]

sentences.english: Friends chatting in, people ask, "Where work is still published?"
sentences.chinese: 友聊天兒，人問起“作品還在哪裏發表？”

sentences.english: On the seventeenth day of the month, he started pulling once more round the clock .
sentences.chinese: 十七那天，他開始去拉車，賃的是“整天兒”。

sentences.english: become familiar with the people and you just make small conversation.
sentences.chinese: 和那裏的人混熟，然後聊聊天兒。

sentences.english: I enjoy a chat with a friend.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡與朋友在一起聊天兒。

sentences.english: The movie's production team for "Oh My God" is weirdly star-studded.
sentences.chinese: 電影《從天兒降》的製作團隊可謂是衆星雲集。

sentences.english: But it's so hot today, why do you wear a suit?
sentences.chinese: 不過這麼熱的天兒，你爲什麼要穿西裝？

sentences.english: I think it will continue to be fine.
sentences.chinese: 我想這種天兒能持續下去。

sentences.english: It's a nice day and we're free this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 天兒很好，今天下午還沒事。

sentences.english: It is so cold that I keep shivering.
sentences.chinese: 天兒太冷了，我直打寒戰。

sentences.english: In September, even under the northern sky, a cold cool thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 北方的九月，連下幾場冷雨，天兒就徹底的涼了起來。

definition: lit. rarely seen, very strange (idiom); to express amazement due to lack of experience/naive expression of excitement due to ignorance
to talk endlessly on the phone
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
weary old body (colloquial term, used jocularly or irreverently)
reunion after an absence is sweeter than being newlyweds (idiom)/absence makes the heart grow fonder
